snippet: The Senate voted to begin debating the bipartisan immigration proposal, giving President Obama a chance to reach the kind of landmark accord with Republicans that has eluded him.
abstract: Senate votes overwhelmingly to begin debating bipartisan immigration proposal, giving Pres Obama a chance to reach the kind of landmark accord with Republicans that has eluded him; advocates hail the vote as an encouraging sign for the measure's eventual passage, but Senate veterans warn that the procedural victory does not preclude Republicans from ultimately rejecting the legislation.

byline.original: By MARK LANDLER and ASHLEY PARKER

lead_paragraph: The Senate voted to begin debating the bipartisan immigration proposal, giving President Obama a chance to reach the kind of landmark accord with Republicans that has eluded him.

headline.seo: Obama Endorses Immigration Bill as Debate Is Set
headline.main: Obama Backs Bill to Overhaul Immigration as Debate Is Set
headline.print_headline: Obama Endorses Immigration Bill As Debate Is Set
